Kuhinjska deska: steklena, lesena ali plastična?
Ni vseeno, iz kakšnega materiala je deska, na kateri režete hrano; katera je najboljša?
04 Nov 2019, 06:50 by Mateja Florjančič



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTONjeno površino razkužita sol in sok limone.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOLeseno moramo vedno pomivati ročno. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOPlastična je primerna za rezanje surovega mesa.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOZačimbe, zelenjavo in sadje sekljamo na leseni deski.


Desko za rezanje uporabljate vsak dan. Na njej režete zelenjavo, sir, salamo, meso, tudi kruh. Skratka, je nepogrešljiv kuhinjski pripomoček, ki je na voljo v različnih materialih. Prisegate na leseno, plastično ali stekleno? Vsaka ima svoje prednosti in slabosti. Pa poglejmo.
Plastična ni varnejša od lesene
Zaradi dejstva, da lesene ni priporočljivo prati v pomivalnem stroju, je večina prepričana, da na njej ostane več zdravju škodljivih bakterij in druge umazanije kot na plastični, ki ob tem vpija še manj tekočine. Vendar plastična deska ni do zdravja prijaznejša od lesene. Kajti kot je dokazalo več študij, med njimi tista strokovnjakov z univerze Michigan, so plastične deske sprva res varnejše in jih je lažje čistiti. A to velja le, dokler so povsem gladke in na njih ni zarez, ki se pojavijo sčasoma zaradi stika z nožem, v njih pa se začnejo kopičiti bakterije, ki jih je nemogoče uničiti, ne glede na to, ali desko pomivate strojno ali ročno.Na drugi strani bakterije na lesenih deskah prehajajo globlje v porozni material, kjer se zaradi do njih neprijaznih razmer ne morejo razmnoževati ter na koncu odmrejo. Prav tako je lesena deska prijaznejša do nožev, saj ti ob rezanju na njej dlje ohranijo ostrino, je pa res, da med pripravo denimo svežega mesa vpije več sokov, ki ga to izloča.


Leseno moramo vedno pomivati ročno. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Kaj pa deska iz stekla? Ta ni najboljša izbira iz dveh razlogov: rezanje hrane na njej je glasno in vsak rez odmeva po stanovanju, poleg tega se ob stiku z njo hitreje poškodujejo rezila nožev. Njeni edini prednosti sta enostavno čiščenje ter vzdrževanje, a po drugi strani hitreje zdrsne iz vlažnih rok.
Vsaj dve in redno čiščenje
Steklena deska je primerna za oblikovanje testa, izrezovanje keksov in podobno. Tako bodo pulti ob peki čistejši.Na plastični je priporočljivo rezati meso, saj v njeno površino ne morejo pronicati sokovi tega živila. Jo pa je treba redno menjati, da se v zarezah ne bi nakopičilo preveč do zdravja neprijaznih bakteriji.Lesena je idealna za rezanje kruha, sira, zelenjave, suhih mesnin, kuhanega mesa in podobnih živil.Če prisegate na les, izberite deske iz tršega lesa, denimo javorjevega, hrastovega ali bambusovega, saj te zdržijo dlje.Po vsaki uporabi jo dobro operite, in to na roke, in osušite, vsaj enkrat na mesec pa jo temeljito razkužite. Najenostavneje tako, da jo natrete s soljo, zdrgnete s polovico limone, splaknete in posušite. Učinkovita za razkuževanje je mešanica jedilne sode in alkoholnega kisa. S tako pripravljeno pasto premažite površino deske, počakajte nekaj minut, nato pa jo zdrgnite, splaknite in posušite.


Plastična je primerna za rezanje surovega mesa.GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Kadar na njej pripravljate živila z močnim vonjem – česen, čebulo, ribe in podobno –, se tega znebite tako, da jo poškropite z alkoholnim kisom, zdrgnete s polovico limone ali soljo, nato pa operete in posušite. Za dodatno zaščito jo občasno premažite z oljem, denimo orehovim, ki mu dodamo malo čebeljega voska, ali pa oljčnim.

Kitchen board: glass, wooden or plastic?
It does not matter what material the board on which you cut food is made; which one is best?
04 Nov 2019, 06:50 by Mateja Florjancic



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTON The surface is disinfected with salt and lemon juice.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTThe wood must always be washed manually. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOPlastic is suitable for cutting raw meat.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOCut spices, vegetables and fruits on a wooden board.


You use a cutting board every day. You can cut vegetables, cheese, salami, meat and bread on it. In short, it is an indispensable cookware available in a variety of materials. Swear on wooden, plastic or glass? Each has its advantages and disadvantages. Let's see.
Plastic is no safer than wooden
Due to the fact that it is not advisable to wash wooden in the dishwasher, most are convinced that it contains more harmful bacteria and other dirt than plastic, which absorbs even less liquid. However, the plastic board is not healthier than the wooden board. Because, as several studies have shown, including those from the University of Michigan, plastic boards are really safer at first and easier to clean. But this is only true until they are completely smooth and do not have a notch, which eventually develops due to contact with the knife, and they begin to accumulate bacteria that are impossible to destroy, whether you wash the board mechanically or manually. On the other hand, the bacteria on the wooden boards move deeper into the porous material, where they are not able to reproduce due to unfavorable conditions and eventually die. The wooden board is also kinder to the knives, because when cut on it they keep the sharpness longer, but it is true that during the preparation of, for example, fresh meat, it absorbs more of the juice it secretes.


We should always wash the wooden by hand. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

What about a glass board? This is not the best choice for two reasons: cutting food on it is loud, and every cut echoes around the apartment, and when touched, the knife blades are damaged more quickly. Its only advantages are easy cleaning and maintenance, but on the other hand it slips out of wet hands faster.
At least two and regular cleaning
The glass board is suitable for making dough, cutting out biscuits and the like. This way, the countertops will be cleaner when baking. It is advisable to cut the meat on the plastic because the juices of this food cannot penetrate the surface. However, it should be changed regularly so that the incisions do not accumulate too much to the health of bacteria that is unfriendly. Wood is ideal for slicing bread, cheese, vegetables, dried meats, cooked meats and similar foods. such as maple, oak or bamboo, as they last longer. Wash it thoroughly after each use and dry it and thoroughly disinfect at least once a month. The easiest way is to rub it with salt, rub with half a lemon, rinse and dry. Effective for disinfection is a mixture of baking soda and alcoholic vinegar. With the paste so prepared, coat the surface of the board, wait for a few minutes, then rub it, rinse and dry.


Plastic is suitable for cutting raw meat.GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

When preparing high-odor foods - garlic, onions, fish and the like - you can get rid of it by sprinkling it with alcoholic vinegar, rubbing it with half a lemon or salt, then washing and drying it. From time to time, coat it with oil, such as walnuts with some beeswax, or olive oil.
